IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The Banfield Charitable Trust funds or administers programs that keep pets and families together. The mission is carried out through 1) funding grants for other pet nonprofits, 2) scholarships and education programs that ensure enough trained pet care industry workers, and 3) free preventive care and/or urgent care funding for financially challenged pet owners.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The Banfield Charitable Trust funds or administers programs that keep pets and families together. The mission is carried out through 1) funding grants for other pet nonprofits, 2) scholarships and education programs that ensure enough trained pet care industry workers, and 3) free preventive care and/or urgent care funding for financially challenged pet owners.
IRS990.Description: The trust awarded pet wellness plans and charity bucks to over 500 Banfield pet hospitals so that clients of those hospitals would have the means to provide veterinary care for their pets. The trust also awarded grants to a number of universities and charitable groups to promote the wellness of animals.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Each grant recipient is required to submit a six month progress report and an annual progress report. Timing begins when the grant funds are mailed. Grant recipients are required to report how they are spending the money as compared with the budget they submitted to obtain the grant.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: An annual $15,000 (maximum) bonus is available to the Executive Director. Award is based on performance objectives from the prior year and compensation is approved by a vote of the board majority.
EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S BASE COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS ARE PAID BY AN UNRELATED PARTY

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990 was reviewed by the Executive Committee prior to filing. Further, it was distributed to each non-Executive Committee board member with a request and deadline for feedback.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The board reviews potential conflicts of interest and enforces the conflict of interest policy.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization mails information upon request.
The process for reviewing financial statements and selecting an independent auditor have not changed from prior year.
